page.title: 02 Weethley Church
page.content: Weethley was mentioned in the original Domesday Book.The present church,built in 1857-1858 is made of grey Lias limestone in 13th Century style.It also has a timbered porch and vestry.The church has three stained glass windows: Centre-Christ in Majesty Left -St.James with shell symbol Right -St.John with eagle. In the church garden there is a yew tree which is many centuries old.The Very Reverend Allan Shaw takes the services every Sunday afternoon with an average congregation of 15.The two church-wardens are Mr.Savage and Mr.Wellings.The women of the parish made the altar cloth-a tapestry of the four seasons.This little country church is situated in the picturesque Vale of Evesham.
